"© 2020 Sven Stoll, AccessComplete (forked from StreetComplete)
© 2016–2020 Tobias Zwick and contributors, StreetComplete v26.2"
Unable to reach the authorization server
StreetComplete makes it easy to contribute to OpenStreetMap.\nIt automatically looks for missing details in your vicinity: bicycle lanes, house numbers, opening hours and much more…
Once found, the missing details will appear on your map as quests.\n\nYou can start solving them right away and later login to publish your answers.
Whenever you are uncertain, you can always reply \"Can\'t Say\" and leave a note.\n\nFinally, remember to stay safe: Be aware of your surroundings and don\'t enter private property.
"Authorization failed: All listed permissions need to be granted"
You published no quest answers yet
Your statistics are still syncing. Check this screen later.
You have %d not yet published changes. You need to login to have them uploaded.
"Space in megabytes reserved on external storage to cache map tiles"
"Also showing notes not phrased as questions"
"You can leave a public note at this location which other mappers can comment on and hopefully resolve or alternatively just hide the quest for yourself only"
Do you want to delete this picture?
Adding a photo will make the note much more useful.
"Can you contribute anything to this note?"
"Can’t scan here. Try to zoom in further or tilt the map less."
"Stop the current search and scan here instead?"
"Location is off. Open Settings to turn it on now?"
"Your location is needed to scan for quests in your vicinity."
"You need to authorize with your OSM user account to publish your answers. Authorize now?"
"This version of StreetComplete is too old. Please update!"
"To scan for quests around you automatically, turn on location"

"

Ah, someone who cares about privacy, nice! I think I have only good news for you:

Direct Contributions

First off, understand that with this app, you make actual and direct contributions to the OpenStreetMap.
Anything you contribute in this app is directly added to the map, there is no third party in-between the app and OSM infrastructure, like it is the case with wheelmap.org or Kort.

Editing the OpenStreetMap anonymously is not possible, so any changes you make are made with your OSM user account. This means, that the date, content and implicitly the location of your changes are visible publicly on the openstreetmap website and are attributable to your account.

Location

The app does not share your GPS location with anyone. It is used to automatically scan for quests around your area and to focus (and thus download) the map around your location.

Data Usage

As mentioned, the app directly communicates with OSM infrastructure.
However, before uploading your changes, the app checks with a simple text file on my server whether it has been banned from uploading any changes. This is a precautionary measure to be able to keep versions of the app that turn out to have critical bugs from possibly corrupting OSM data.

"

"

To display the map, vector tiles are retrieved from %1$s. See their privacy statement for more information.

"
Photos you attach to a note are uploaded to my server and deleted some days after that note has been resolved. Their meta-data is stripped before upload.
The data shown in your profile is aggregated from your publicly available contribution history to OpenStreetMap and then hosted on my server.
What\'s the surface of the highlighted sidewalk (dotted line)?
"What's the surface of the highlighted sidewalk of the road %s (dotted line)?"
"What surface does this path have in this segment?"
"What surface does this piece of road have?"
"What surface does the road %s have in this segment?"
"What surface does the square %s have in this segment?"
"Select the most specific one that fits:"
"How many lanes does this road have?"
"What is the house number of this building?"
"Would you please send the error report to the developer?"
"Connection error while scanning for quests. Try again later."
"Connection error while uploading answers. Try again later."
"Does this bus stop have tactile pavings?"
"Does this streetcar stop have tactile pavings?"
"Does this crosswalk have tactile pavings on both sides?"
Are you sure you checked this on-site?
Only information that was found on a survey should be entered.
"Does the bus stop %s have tactile pavings?"
"Does the streetcar stop %s have tactile pavings?"
Don’t show again for this session
Is this bus station wheelchair accessible?
Is this subway entrance wheelchair accessible?
Is this train station wheelchair accessible?
Is the bus station %s wheelchair accessible?
Is the restroom at %s wheelchair accessible?
Is the subway entrance %s wheelchair accessible?
Is the train station %s wheelchair accessible?
Partially means that there is no more than a single step to access the place and that most rooms inside are wheelchair accessible.
Partially means that there is no more than a single step to access it.
Partially means that there is no more than a single step to access it.
"A wheelchair sign like this might be visible if the restroom is accessible. Partially means that a wheelchair can enter and use the restroom, but no handrail or adapted hand basin is present."
"See the project on POEditor for a complete list."
So, there is a sign like this?
What kind of crossing is this?
Unable to create file for photo
Long-press and move a quest to reorder its priority for display on the map.
This quest type is disabled by default because you will likely have to enter the place to be able to answer a quest of this type.
Zoom in further to create a note
You can leave a note to let other mappers know about an issue here. Adjust the note’s position by moving the map:
Useful if you think that some quests are outdated

Invalidating the cache causes the quests to be updated next time they are downloaded. The quest cache is invalidated automatically after one week and immediately when a quest you solved turns out to be already answered by someone else.
Are you sure that you can not determine it more specifically?
Reset both quest enablement and order to the default?
Please select a more specific value.
To upload your changes manually, use the button in the toolbar that looks like this.
Are there sound signals for the blind here?
Do these traffic lights have a button to request a walk signal?
Do these traffic lights have a tactile indication for blind people for when it\'s safe to cross?
Hint: Often this is a vibrating button or rotating cone on the underside of the traffic light button case.
Are pedestrians prohibited from walking on this road in this segment?
This street was tagged as having no sidewalk on either side. In the case that there is a sidewalk after all but it is displayed as a separate way, please answer \"sidewalk\".
Best write the note in the locally spoken language or otherwise in English.
What\'s the surface of the cycleway in this segment?
What\'s the surface of the footway in this segment?
If it differs along the way, the first step is to split up the way. After that, the quest can be answered for each split part separately.\nSplit it now?
Tap on the way to split it at the point(s) where the answer differs. Try to be as precise as possible, you can zoom in as usual.
These are quite a few splits. You can always further split up the way later.
You can also do this later on the profile screen.
Do these steps have a handrail?
Do these steps have a ramp? What kind?
Is the wheelchair ramp displayed as a separate way on the map?
Which direction leads upwards for these steps?
The road in the illustration is rotated the same as on the map at the location of the pin.
The road in the illustration is rotated the same as on the map at the location of the pin. Note the indicated direction.
Learning more about OSM and its community
Editors and other ways to contribute to OpenStreetMap
Interesting map-related stuff for you to try out
A map for finding wheelchair accessible places
Create tactile maps easily for any address
Tactile maps for the visually impaired in various scales
Fully-featured OSM editor for the desktop. This is the power tool for regular contributors.
Simple OSM editor for the browser. Optimized for the desktop or large tablets
Create maps with custom data quickly and embed them in your site
A map of public transport routes and stops
Contribute to OSM simply by looking at pictures of your city
The wiki is your starting point to everything related OpenStreetMap
New to OpenStreetMap? This is a beginner\'s guide
A huge collection of statistics for OpenStreetMap contributors, like where and how you contributed, who else is around you plus leaderboards
Map that shows recent natural disasters, interesting for humanitarian mappers. Also, shows many interesting statistics to analyze how well-mapped and up-to-date places are.
General information about OpenStreetMap and how to work with OSM as an organization
Turn by turn navigation for wheelchair users
"Generate printable city maps in a few easy steps, optionally with a street directory"
Watch OSM edits happen in real time
Routing for a variety of vehicles and on foot, each with preferences. Can also show isochrones (reachable area in X minutes from a starting point).
Using OSM data to generate a haiku (a form of Japanese poetry)
The weekly news blog about what\'s happening in the OpenStreetMap world
Welcome to the OpenStreetMap community! In your profile screen, you can see more info for each quest type you solved.
You solved %d quests! Keep going to unlock more achievements that contain links to OSM and other map-related apps and projects!
You contributed %d days to OSM with this app! Regular contributors are the backbone of OSM, thanks for your dedication! ❤
You solved %d quests that help wheelchair users get around town!
You solved %d quests that are interesting for visually impaired.
You solved %d quests that are interesting for people on foot!
You found and solved %d quests that are completed really rarely, congratulations!
You have %d unread messages in your inbox

Are you sure that it is impossible to specify the surface? Note the \"Differs along the way\" answer option that allows you to cut the way where the surface changes. Please use \"Can\'t say\" if there is a single surface but it is not available as an answer.
Please briefly specify the nature of the surface here, for example \"sandy with patches of cobblestone\". The text length is limited to 255 characters.
"Does this pedestrian crossing have an island?"
Compass: Tap to orient map to north or toggle 3D view if it is already faced north.
"You need to grant this app the camera permission in order to take a picture."
"An image that illustrates the measurement process visually."

Slowly move the camera to discover the surfaces and objects around you. Once an area was scanned successfully, you will see a cloud of points on the surfaces. Afterwards, fixate two points in the environment with a simple tap on the screen to measure a distance.
Marks where the note will be created
Sidewalk is displayed separately on map
"What's the maximum incline of this path?"
"What's the maximum incline of this piece of road?"
What\'s the maximum incline of the road %s in this segment?
Orient yourself on the street according to the arrows displayed on the map.\n
Place your phone flat on the floor with the screen facing upwards.\n
Lock/unlock the measurement by taping on it
Orient yourself on the street according to the arrows displayed on the map.\n
Measure the slope with a (digital) level and enter the value below.
An incline of %1$d %% seems very implausible for a street. Please try to measure again or leave a note instead.
"What kind of curb exists at this point of the pedestrian crossing?"
"What kind of curb does this traffic island have?"
Raised sufficiently to prevent traversal by wheelchairs, as well as to impede bicycles.
The curb is lowered or only slightly raised.
There is no difference in height between the curb and the street.

"What's the minimum width of the path in this segment?"
"What's the minimum width of the cycleway in this segment?"
"What's the minimum width of the footway in this segment?"
"What's the minimum width of this piece of road?"
"What's the minimum width of the highlighted sidewalk (dotted line)?"
"What's the minimum width of the road %s in this segment?"
"What's the minimum width of the highlighted sidewalk of the road %s (dotted line)?"
Please measure the width of the sidewalk at its narrowest section. Also consider permanent objects such as trash cans or street lights when you determine the narrowest point.
A width of %1$s cm seems very implausible for a sidewalk. Please try to measure again or leave a note instead.
A width of %1$s cm is very implausible for a street like this. Please try to measure again or leave a note instead.
The answer refers to the fact whether the surface allows the usage of certain types of wheeled vehicles (without considering the available width).
